dfischer.utils

Class FileCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.FileCache

  • public class FileCache
extends java.lang.Object
    Thread safe cache for reading files from disk.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileCache()
      Create a new empty file cache.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addElement(FileCacheElement newElement)
      Internal.
      FileCacheElement[] getAllElements()
      Thread safe method to get all files in cache.
      java.lang.String[] getAllFileNames()
      Thread safe method to get the names of all cached files.
      long getCacheHits()
      Get the total number of cache hits (statistical data).
      long getCacheMisses()
      Get the total number of cache misses (statistical data).
      FileCacheElement getElement(java.lang.String fileName)
      Internal.
      FileCacheElement readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      Deprecated. 
      since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted files. Thread safe method to read a file from disk through the cache, but do not consider file updates on disk once the file has been cached.
      Note: use this method if you expect that the content of the file does not change during the execution of a load test.
      FileCacheElement readFile(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext, java.lang.String fileName)
      Thread safe method to read a file from disk through the cache, but do not consider file updates on disk once the file has been cached.
      Note: use this method if you expect that the content of the file does not change during the execution of a load test.
      FileCacheElement readFileClone(java.lang.String fileName)
      Deprecated. 
      since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted files. Similar as readFile(String fileName) but create a clone of the cached file data.
      FileCacheElement readFileClone(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext, java.lang.String fileName)
      Similar as readFile(SymmetricEncryptContext, String) but create a clone of the cached file data.
      FileCacheElement readUpdatedFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      Deprecated. 
      since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted files. Thread safe method to read a file from disk through the cache, considers also file updates on disk and updates the cache in such a case.
      Note: use this method if you expect that the content of the file changes during the execution of a load test.
      FileCacheElement readUpdatedFile(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext, java.lang.String fileName)
      Thread safe method to read a file from disk through the cache, considers also file updates on disk and updates the cache in such a case.
      Note: use this method if you expect that the content of the file changes during the execution of a load test.
      FileCacheElement readUpdatedFileClone(java.lang.String fileName)
      Deprecated. 
      since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted files. Similar as readUpdatedFile(fileName) but create a clone of the cached file data.
      FileCacheElement readUpdatedFileClone(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext, java.lang.String fileName)
      Similar as readUpdatedFile(SymmetricEncryptContext, String) but create a clone of the cached file data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileCache

        public FileCache()

    • Method Detail

      • readFile

        public FileCacheElement readFile(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext,
                        java.lang.String fileName)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Thread safe method to read a file from disk through the cache, but do not consider file updates on disk once the file has been cached.
        Note: use this method if you expect that the content of the file does not change during the execution of a load test.
        Parameters:
        decryptContext - the context to decrypt the file, or null if the file is not encrypted
        fileName - the file name (relative or absolute path).
        Returns:
        the cached file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        V5.4-K

      • readFile

        public FileCacheElement readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted files. Thread safe method to read a file from disk through the cache, but do not consider file updates on disk once the file has been cached.
        Note: use this method if you expect that the content of the file does not change during the execution of a load test.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name (relative or absolute path).
        Returns:
        the cached file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readUpdatedFile

        public FileCacheElement readUpdatedFile(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext,
                               java.lang.String fileName)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Thread safe method to read a file from disk through the cache, considers also file updates on disk and updates the cache in such a case.
        Note: use this method if you expect that the content of the file changes during the execution of a load test.
        Parameters:
        decryptContext - the context to decrypt the file, or null if the file is not encrypted
        fileName - the file name (relative or absolute path).
        Returns:
        the cached file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        V5.4-K

      • readUpdatedFile

        public FileCacheElement readUpdatedFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted files. Thread safe method to read a file from disk through the cache, considers also file updates on disk and updates the cache in such a case.
        Note: use this method if you expect that the content of the file changes during the execution of a load test.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name (relative or absolute path).
        Returns:
        the cached file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readFileClone

        public FileCacheElement readFileClone(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext,
                             java.lang.String fileName)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Similar as readFile(SymmetricEncryptContext, String) but create a clone of the cached file data.
        Parameters:
        decryptContext - the context to decrypt the file, or null if the file is not encrypted
        fileName - the file name (relative or absolute path).
        Returns:
        the cached file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        V5.4-K
        See Also:
        readFile(SymmetricEncryptContext, String)

                               throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted files. Similar as readFile(String fileName) but create a clone of the cached file data.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name (relative or absolute path).
        Returns:
        the cached file.
        Throws:

        public FileCacheElement readUpdatedFileClone(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext,

        Similar as readUpdatedFile(SymmetricEncryptContext, String) but create a clone of the cached file data.

      • readUpdatedFileClone

        public FileCacheElement readUpdatedFileClone(java.lang.String fileName)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted files. Similar as readUpdatedFile(fileName) but create a clone of the cached file data.

        Returns:
        the cached file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        readUpdatedFile(String fileName)

      • addElement

        public boolean addElement(FileCacheElement newElement)
        Internal. Thread safe method to add a new file to the cache.
        Note: avoid using this method because new files are normally added to the cache by calling readFile(String fileName) or readUpdatedFile(String fileName).
        Parameters:
        newElement - the new element in cache
        Returns:
        true if a file with the same file name was already cached and is now overwritten in cache, else false if a new file name has been added to the cache.

      • getElement

        public FileCacheElement getElement(java.lang.String fileName)
        Internal. Thread safe method to get a file from the cache.
        Note: avoid using this method because files are normally added to the cache by calling readFile(String fileName) or readUpdatedFile(String fileName).
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name (relative or absolute path) of an already cached file.
        Returns:
        the file from the cache, or null if no such file is in cache

      • getAllFileNames

        public java.lang.String[] getAllFileNames()
        Thread safe method to get the names of all cached files.
        Returns:
        the names of all cached files (relative or absolute path)

      • getAllElements

        public FileCacheElement[] getAllElements()
        Thread safe method to get all files in cache.
        Returns:
        all files in cache

      • getCacheHits

        public long getCacheHits()
        Get the total number of cache hits (statistical data).
        Returns:
        the total number of cache hits

      • getCacheMisses

        public long getCacheMisses()
        Get the total number of cache misses (statistical data).
        Returns:
        the total number of cache misses
